data.text: @VictimOfMaths Do you think this is related to relative increase in home testing, where at least in the US the results are not publicly captured, or decrease in testing overall? So the early warning system is dismantled.

@VictimOfMaths Maybe there is seasonal illness that's interacting with Covid numbers on a positive loop? That interaction may increase the hospitalisation numbers and/or contagion rates without having a genomic shift nor a policy change.

@VictimOfMaths Antoine Flahault, epidemiologist and director of the Institute of Global Health, is quoted today in Le Monde as saying that the European rise can be partly explained by the role of atmospheric pollution, which favors viral propagation through the abrasion of the respiratory path.

@contrarian4data @thereal_truther @OpDracula @VictimOfMaths @Hold2LLC @angrybklynmom @Reroot_Flyover Covid outbreaks highly correlate with temperature,  more so above the 37th parallel. NZ is on the 37th parallel and the ocean, where there is not the trigger you see in more northern latitudes. Even new variants 'wait' until favorable weather before there is an outbreak.
@JDStunda Odds are you know a lot more vaxxed than unvaxxed people, so it’s probably not that weird.
@VictimOfMaths That’s so weird. I only know 1 person who was hospitalized within the past month. She was double vaxxed.
@JDStunda Not in this data, but the UKHSA vaccine surveillance reports regularly show that the hospitalisation rate is much higher in unvaccinated vs vaccinated groups at all ages.
@VictimOfMaths Do we know how many are vaccinated and unvaccinated?
